title: Man City midfielder Fernandinho vows to learn from his red card mistakes
text:
Man City midfielder Fernandinho vows to learn from his red card mistakes Brazil star had missed eight out of the last 11 games through suspension Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now City v West Ham player ratings Share this video Get Manchester City FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Fernandinho says he will learn from his mistakes after serving his second ban of the season. 
And, while he would not have chosen it, he grudgingly accepts that being suspended for seven games in the English winter might just re-charge his batteries for the rest of Manchester City 's campaign. 
The Brazilian picked up his second Premier League red card of the season for a two-footed challenge against Burnley on January 2, earning him a four-match ban. 
That came after he was sent off, and handed three matches, for grabbing and pushing Cesc Fabregas during the defeat by Chelsea in December, ten days after he was also, unfairly, red-carded against Borussia Monchengladbach. 
Fernandinho hinted that he is still a little perplexed at the application of the rules, but vowed to take on board the lessons. 
“People know me from three seasons here,” he said after his comeback as a sub in the 4-0 win at West Ham. “I have never been like this, so they changed the way to punish the players this season. 
“It means I have missed seven games, but I have to accept that. 
“It's hard, but it was about being ready when I got the chance and West Ham was my first time after the ban. Read More Man City trio Gabriel Jesus, Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling are too pacy for teammates! 
“Now I have to work hard to get in the squad.” 
Fernandinho has, in the past, faded slightly after putting too much energy into the first half of the season, so the enforced break might just have a silver lining for him. 
“It's not the way I would have liked!” he said. “I just want to learn from these mistakes and we are now ready for a February that has the Champions League and some good games. 
“I hope we can win most and be near the top.” Read More
